inclusion.criterion: Female volunteers in early to mid-puberty
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Inability to comprehend what will be done during the study or why it will done
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Hyperandrogenism (e.g., hirsutism, elevated free testosterone level)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of allergy to progesterone (which is extremely rare)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Hemoglobin less than 12 g/dl and hematocrit less than 36%
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Persistently abnormal sodium, potassium, or bicarbonate (i.e. confirmed on repeat)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Persistently elevated creatinine, hepatic transaminases, or alkaline phosphatase (i.e., confirmed on repeat)
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Total bilirubin > 1.5 times upper limit of normal (i.e. confirmed on repeat)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Significant history of cardiac or pulmonary dysfunction (e.g., known or suspected congestive heart failure; asthma requiring intermittent systemic corticosteroids; etc.)
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Untreated hypo- or hyperthyroidism, reflected by persistently abnormal thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) values
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Premature adrenarche (i.e., occurring before age 8 y)
exclusion.label: met

notes: The patient has a history of Wegener's granulomatosis and is currently being treated with corticosteroid and cyclophosphamides. His Birmingham Vasculitis Activity Score (BVAS) is above 4 since the beginning of his disease.
